column4: I currently have a GUI ubuntu install setup for remote accessing, therefore without a monitor plugged in, except after the reboot without the monitor, it seems to only be able to start X at 640x480 resolution, is there any way I could force it to run at a higher resolution?
in the GUI configuration it only lists 640x480 at 60hz
you might want to try using freenx or fall back on ssh -X , that way you're not tied to the resolution at the other end.
